comment: 41:40, why does it have the largest momentum? Pf-pi =0 (since it's bouncing back), while our clay ball has pf of 0 which means ∆p=p and fully acted the force on the door?? Plus ain't it external force? Shouldn't it be equal... I'm really confused 😕
if you have a lecture on angular momentum can you please post it? it would be greatly appreciated.

same force applied to both balls for the same duration of time so they will have the same momentum (same force&time---> same impulse ---> same change of momentum) - my professor did the same example in my class and that is what he said (tbh conceptually i dont get it either but maybe his answer can help u)
@haydenjump  Yup! u got me right. It's like saying a pound of feathers and a pound of steel. same force and same mass.

Unfortunately I do not cover it in my class at the moment due to limited time, so I have no video to upload. However, I do hope to eventually record additional lectures/topics beyond what I teach in class.
